body:
The latest version of [nose](http://nose.readthedocs.io/en/latest/) starts with the following note to users:
> Nose has been in maintenance mode for the past several years and will likely cease without a new person/team to take over maintainership. New projects should consider using Nose2, py.test, or just plain unittest/unittest2.

I was wondering if after `v0.10` we should consider moving to [py.test](http://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/) or we should remain with the version of nose that's currently in `lib/external`. 

In case there's consensus around this, I wouldn't mind experimenting with `py.test` to see how much this change will be doable / painful.
title: Nose: note to users in latest version
